sentence.value: Marcos Cesar Pontes (born March 11, 1963) is a Brazilian Air Force pilot and AEB astronaut.

sentence.value: He became the first Brazilian and the first Lusophone to go into space when he launched to the International Space Station aboard Soyuz TMA-8 on March 30, 2006.

sentence.value: In June 1998, he was selected by the Brazilian Space Agency to train in the NASA space program after he acquired a space-related background in the Aeronatical Engineering division of the Instituto Tecnológico de Aeronáutica (the Aeronautics Technological Institute, or "ITA"), which he transferred to in pursuit of a childhood dream to become an astronaut.

sentence.value: On September 2, 2005, an agreement which cost about US$20 million between the governments of Brazil and Russia provided for Pontes to train at Star City, near Moscow, to learn about the Soyuz's operational and life-support systems, and to fly to the International Space Station in March 2006.

sentence.value: Following the Soyuz mission, Pontes returned to his technical duties for the International Space Station Program at the Johnson Space Center, working with FIESP/SENAI-SP for the development and fabrication of the Brazilian parts for the ISS.

sentence.value: Pontes is on stand-by for training for future Brazilian space flights.
sentence.annotated-sentence: [[Pontes|Dulce_Pontes]] is on stand-by for [[training|Training]] for future Brazilian [[space|Space]] [[flights|Flight]].
